Review Contents: I upgraded to these from the RS 140's that I purchased over 10 years ago.  Technology has definitely changed for the better.  Definitely set these up using the optical (Toslink) connection so you are getting digital sound.  The frequency response is quite amazing, the quiet parts are dead silent no hiss no hum like on analog TV headphones.  With the bass boost the sound is thunderous!  Range is not quite as far as I would have expected but then again I'm moving from room to room and not within direct line of sight to the transmitter...none the less from one end of the house to the other with few drop outs.  I also bought the HDR 175 Accessory headphone and was concerned about being able to charge only one headphone at a time...so far has not been a problem the charges seem to last a long time (many days) and just rotate the headphones on the charger.  Still order Panasonic Eneloop rechargeable batteries just in case...they are the best longest lasting rechargables available...be sure to check these out.
Title: Technology has definitely changed for the better. Definitely set these up using the optical (Toslink) ...

Review Contents: Let's see...16hr battery life, a rechargeable station, and I swear they have some noise-cancelling technology despite what Sennheiser says.  I can wear these all day long.  They are comfortable, the controls are easy to reach and are notched so you can feel them, and they provide solid sound.  I can't speak about the quality of the sound other than to say the bass is there, the treble is there, and I have zero complaints about sound.The headset has some nice padding on top to prevent headaches or strains on your head.  The earcups are padded and cover the entire ear.I took off one star only because it is VERY easy to snap the plastic notches that hold the earcups in place when replacing batteries.  However, there are three of those plastic notches so breaking one won't result in a loose earcup.These headphones are so good, I bought a second set just to have one set charging while I wear the other set.Also, Sennheiser says you can't mix and match these headsets and wireless receivers.  The HDR175 only works with the RF175 and not other units.  Be careful when you're shopping.
Title: The all-day wireless headphones

Review Contents: We have downsized our living quarters temporarily and loud sound is not an option. I purchased these headphones to replace our stereo system for the time being. They replace a 5.1 surround system that has served us faithfully for years. I have to say the sound quality, ease-of-use, and overall end result has been a surprise and a blessing. It has taken a bit of mucking around in the tv/ device/ headphone settings to get the overall stereo effect as accurate as we could, but that was expected. The Bass is rich and relatively tight, the mids are clear, and the high end is superb. We get sound all the way out to the kitchen 30ft away with no problem (yes, snack runs during commercials). I purchased a second pair of headphones for my wife and we have been loving them.
Title: We have downsized our living quarters temporarily and loud sound ...

Review Contents: Recently purchased two units so that I can enjoy movies late night without waking anyone up. Out of the box once I turned one on it didn't register any sound right away. However, upon further inspection I suspect that it was searching for a channel so don't be discouraged if it doesn't have any sound right away. It is well constructed and sturdy.Pros:-Nice sleek design.-Buttons easily accessible on the headset.-ComfortableCons:-uses AAA batteries( and even I don't think this is a huge issue)-can only charge one headset at a time unless you buy another receiver.
Title: Recently purchased two units so that I can enjoy movies late night without waking anyone up

Review Contents: These are great headphones for use with music: I'm using them for watching movies.  They're not surround but they have tremendous bass response and clear mid range and treble response as well.  I like the ability to control the volume right from the headset, control the surround mode, and bass-boost, and with the 2nd set of headphones that works from the main unit I can have a guest wear a headset as well.  Great for late night movie watching when you don;'t want to disturb the neighbors.
Title: These are great headphones for use with music

Review Contents: I bought these accessory headphones for my wife. I liked the original set that came with the Sennheiser 175 transmitter, and wanted my wife to be able to enjoy the sound they produce, especially for movies streamed on TV. These are a duplicate of the same headphones that come with the 175 set of headphones and a transmitter. They are great!The single transmitter supports 2 sets of headphones without loss of sound quality to either set.If you have difficulty hearing the dialogue when you play movies, this seems to be the perfect solution. 5 STARS in my opinion.
Title: I liked the original set that came with the Sennheiser 175 ...

Review Contents: LOVE these.  I had one pair for my husband, who needs the TV louder than me and who stays up later than me.  But when we would watch some of the British shows, Masterpiece and the like, I missed some of the dialogue or didn't understand accents and slang.  When I used his headphones, I could hear everything so much clearer.  Like going from analog TV to HD digital, you can see so much more detail.  This was the audio equivalent for me.  So we got another set of headphones that worked with the same transceiver he used.  Now we can both wear headphones whenever we like.  Sometimes just him, sometimes just me, and many times both of us are wearing them.  We connected the transceiver to the digital optical out jack on the TV, so we can use the headphones for our live OTA TV, the Firestick streaming TV, and the DVD player audio. Definitely worth the money, we did get them on sale.
Title: No more blaring TV sound!

Review Contents: My husband and I were having hearing problems and could not hear the British shows plus some American stations.  One American station, I had to try to lip read as the back ground noise interfered with the words.  The Sennheiser head phones have solved our dilemma. We can now hear every show and the sound is excellent.  We are both very pleased with this purchase and have already recommend the Sennheiser head phones to others.  I can honestly give this product a 5 star.
Title: We can now hear every show and the sound is excellent. We are both very pleased with this purchase ...

Review Contents: A second set of headphones for the Sennheiser 175. They are interchangeable with the pair that come with the transmitter/charger.  You can only charge one pair at a time, so you need to keep track of which ones have been recently charged.  They seem to last 2 or 3 days after charging, depending on how much you use them.  A small gripe, and why I didn't give them 5 stars, is that there's no way to check the remaining charge without putting them back on the charger.  They do give you warning beeps if the charge is getting low, but I'd like to be able to check myself.  When removing them from the charger, it tells you, by 1 to 4 flashes of an LED, how much charge they have, but I'd love to be able to check from my easy chair.  See my review of the main Sennheiser HDR 175 set for pros and cons of full ear enclosure.
Title: Sound is great.  Needs to be used with the HDR 175 charger/transmitter.  Fully encloses your ears.

Review Contents: Disappointed. Going on my 3rd set. First Pair worked 2 weeks before hiss sound starts, second pair for one day. If I hadn’t tossed my first orig. packaging, I’d hav given up by now. Going to try 3rd pair. Unhapppy but when they work, they do  sound great -but there appear to be a lot of lemons as I got 2 in a row. I”m hoping the 3rd times a charm. Went to Sennheiser.com and saw people writing in with same issue and Hiss should not be happening.
Title: Beware of lemons - save your packaging for a full month to make sure you don’t have One!

Review Contents: Great when someone else is in the room and not watching TV - or someone wants to listen to music when the other person doesn't.  The only thing that would make these headphones better is if they were noise cancelling.  Easy side buttons to control the volume, bass and surround sound.
Title: Nice sound

Review Contents: Superb sound. A great investment for me and my wife, because of my hearing loss. I can watch my sports and news shows while my wife reads her books in silence.
Title: Excellent Investment for Our Home

Review Contents: "Downton Abbey" generated desire for a quality, wireless headphone(s). Now "she" can understand the soundtrack! Best thing, we can put volume on each set (I have one too) to desired level. Now, I can listen to ball games without disturbing anyone in house. Should have done this years ago! Units are comfortable, controls easy to use, don't know battery life 'cause haven't run 'em down - six hours listening. Charging station is simple. Materials are good quality. I'd give as a gift.
Title: Hearing improved...

Review Contents: These headphones are spectacular.  They perform as advertises and make our TV viewing (and those not listening) pleasurable.  I would recommend Sennheiser products without hesitation.
Title: I would recommend Sennheiser products without hesitation

Review Contents: Perfect companion to my RS 175 Headphone and charging station. I bought this so I can always have one fully charged . Having said that ,my wife is now using the extra set on movies that have a lot of dialog with background music.  The both of us are now enjoying our TV programs much better. Great job Sennheiser ! Also , this was my first purchase from Amazon. The entire process from researching through receiving the package was very impressive. Great Job Amazon !
Title: Great Headphones

Review Contents: The sound is great. No static like an older, cheaper version of this brand. It blocks out other noises. Only problem is that my husband and I find ourselves shouting at one another, The ear cuff is very snug so my ear aches after awhile, and I don't have large ears!
Title: We love them !

Review Contents: We really appreciate the sound design of movies we watch now without disturbing the neighbors. And the hard of hearing one of us doesn't blast out the other one. Great controls right on the headphones.
Title: Great sound, comfortable headphones

Review Contents: The clarity of sound is amazing! Not only is the actor's "mumbling" voice super clear but there is no forfeiting of the full bass and incredible surround sound! You have it all with these Sennheiser headphones! I now understand EVERY word spoken on The Expanse!! :)
Title: Well done Sennheiser!!

Review Contents: Paired this with the rs 175 rf wireless headphone system so my husband can turn the volume up loud and I can listen to the tv (without headphones) at a much lower volume.  Also, when we need to be quiet for others in the house sleeping, we can both use the headphones at our own volume level while the tv volume is 0.  Great versatility, not too difficult to set up.
Title: Great versatility, not too difficult to set up

Review Contents: The only way to watch a movie at home.  My husband and I both LOVE these headphones. Finally I can hear the words that are being spoken over the background music.  And they are a GREAT plus for when one of us wants continue to watch our favorite show while the other wants to go to bed early.
Title: Great sound and clarity!

Review Contents: Bought these to go along with the headphone system. Headphones have a great sound and are adjustable for volume. Solved the problem of the tv being so loud and very nice to hear the tv while my husband is asleep.
Title: Must have for 2 people

Review Contents: These headphones(we now have two)more than met our expectations.  Sennheiser is a company that has been in professional audio for decades and has excelled.  These headphones reproduce the TV audio like a full price audiophile speaker/amp system would for a fraction of the price.  We never watch shows without them anymore.
Title: More than worth the money!

Review Contents: Great sound, great bass, good soundstage. The distance is a bit shorter than expected, but that's okay.

Review Contents: My husband was so happy with his headset that he bought me one also. I highly recommend these wireless headsets. They make hearing the words spoken on TV so much better. This was money well spent.

These are noticeably improved as they pair very easily and their simulated surround sound feature works great. I grade it down a star because the headphones are very heavy and become uncomfortable to wear after little more than an hour. I hope they break in somehow, because this distraction IS a game-changer.

Title: One Star

Review Contents: Perfect.  Fit very good.  Sound very good.  Seems to automatically control volume fluctuations.  Easy to adjust volume.  Takes a long time to charge but we use two sets and must remember to swap out the units.  We have never run out of power.  These are perfect.
Title: wireless headsets for TV and audio systems.

Review Contents: I purchased the RS 175 for my wife and because it would support two headsets I opted to purchase an additional headset for me.  The charging contacts are of a proprietary nature and it appears that Sennheiser does not have a stand alone charger only available.  So my options are to either share the base unit/charge with my wife or purchase a little third party charger and remove the batteries after using the headset and recharge them.So my beef is that purchasing a second headset I would think that Sennheiser would have a charge available for it. Maybe even throw in a charger since the headphones are not cheap at 170 bucks.I will review the RS 175 later when it's up and running. This is only a comment on a lack of stand alone charger.
Title: What! No charger or cradle???

Review Contents: The 175 system is great, but jeeze - why not include with the accessory headphones a way to charge them at the same time as the main set???  You have 2 headsets and have to decide which ones to put on the base station to charge. If you're away for a couple of weeks one set is always not fully charged when you get back, and you have to remember to switch them out before you need them. Seems like a pretty obvious and essential accessory that Sennheiser has overlooked. The only way is to take out the batteries and use a separate charger.
Title: Come on Sennheiser - add a charger

Review Contents: The sound through these headphones is wonderful.  My husband is hard of hearing and had real problems listening to the TV so is very happy now with his headphones.  If there are negatives, they would be that the set up was not quite as easy as the paperwork makes it seem (or we are just not very techie!) but we eventually figured out that the transmitter had to be plugged in to our DVR vs the TV, and we found the setting on the TV that allows us to go back in forth between sound through the TV or the headphones.  Also, the headphones fit very tight on the head so it start hurting after a short time of wearing them.  I wish there was a way to loosen them up, but can't see any way to do that.
Title: Great sound!

Review Contents: Not going into much detail, but these are EXACTLY what I was looking for.  I like to stay up late after wife and toddler are asleep and for years I just watched movies in frustration because I could not turn up the volume for fear of waking them up.  Got a cheap $30 dollar pair a while back, but the sound was pure crap.So I finally pulled the trigger on these.  A little price at over $200, but after only a week I've realized that price is worth every penny and more.  The sound is phenomenal.  Love the bass boost (which is REALLY strong, even too strong at times) especially when i'm listening to music (mostly on youtube or iheartradio app on the TV).  I'm actually typing this review as I'm back in my bedroom listening to them, the range on these is incredible.  Completely opposite ends of the house (granted i do have a small house).Incredibly easy installation.  I highly recommend using the optical cord connection for best sound.  It comes with RCA inputs which I'll never use i'm sure.  I've read other reviews on here that say the sound from RCA is vastly inferior.The volume controls and virtual surround and bass boost buttons only took me a couple of uses to really get comfortable with, and are very convenient.The batteries take a looooong time to charge (especially initially).  I wanted to try them out so bad when I got home from work the day they were delivered, but didn't want to mess with their initial charge.  The next day I realized I could've just put in two other AAA batteries, but oh well (I also ordered at 36 pack of triple A's from Amazon for about 11 bucks so if they go out while using them, i'll just pop some other cheap batteries in until I get the rechargables going again.Only complaint I have is that the price lowered 12 bucks they day after I placed my order hahagreat product, thinking about getting my wife a pair for her birthday (which is also another great feature.  I can buy another head set for about 170 and it will sync in with the charging dock too).
Title: Sennheiser:  Shut up and take my money!

Review Contents: Sound very good. Worked perfect after the initial charging session. No problem pairing with the RS175 with or without an additional set of headphones connected. Both fiber optic and RCA settings sound great. Still playing around with the surround and bass settings.
Title: Sound very good. Worked perfect after the initial charging session

Review Contents: Pairs instantly with base.  Batteries had a charge out of the box so could use it immediately.  Comfortable after long use, not too heavy and very enveloping with passive noise cancellation.  Now I can understand the movies I watch without waking up the kids.
Title: Comfortable after long use

Review Contents: Awesome sound quality!!  Very comfortable.  We have 2 headsets running off of the same base and it's great.  And the fact that the product transmits on radio frequency means that I don't have to have the base in direct line with the head sets when in use.  I can put the base out of site.  In fact, my husband can put the trash out on the curb and still hear TV dialog!!!  Highly recommend.
Title: Awesome sound quality

Review Contents: I would so buy these if they worked with a wire. That would be great. When i forst saw this i was like, i so want these headphones, then i saw they were wireless without bluetooth and didnt work with cable and i was sad.
Title: Would buy if worked with wire or bluetooth.

Review Contents: This Sennheiser 175 is a set of wireless headphones intended for home use that offer excellent range and thunderous bass.PROSPowerful wireless audio output. Digital and analog inputs. Bass mode increases low-end dramatically, but can be disabled. Excellent transmission—never stuttered during testing, even through walls.CONSSound signature is quite sculpted. Can distort in Bass mode on deep bass tracks at high volumes. Not portable; only for home use.A good compare would be this version that is a bit pricier but offers fuller Sennheiser features: http://amzn.to/1jCJgN5
Title: ++ Intended for home use but offers excellent range and thunderous bass ++

Review Contents: Works the same as the original one that came with the charger base.
Title: Five Stars

Review Contents: FIT: O.K.  Not the best, BUT - NOT a deal breaker.BANG FOR THE BUCK: O.K.  Pricey, it is a well made and premium product.SOUND  This is where it shines.  My fav. is the surrround sound - but it does drain the recharg. batt.BASE: +is: It is a nice "home".  -is: recharge is slooow.Bottom Line: Solid 4 out of 5.
Title: Not the best, BUT - NOT a deal breaker
